data.title: Awesome place!
data.text: Fabulous wine selection....all are high quality! If you need help making a selection ask for Mike Reid. He is extremely knowledgeable and can make recommendations that are selected for your taste. Food was excellent. I enjoyed the special of the day which was a pasta dish with grilled chicken...others members of our group had the fried chicken, pizza, mozzarella balls and everyone loved what they got. Parking is challenging. After your meal stroll around and enjoy some of the other specialty stores in the same area!

data.title: "Pizza Before A Movie"
data.text:
I was going to see a movie at the nearby movie theater and was looking for a place to eat at.  This looked just fine.  The pizza was gourmet type and the staff was friendly.  It was a bit pricey, but not unreasonable.  Try it....you will like it.  I would go back when next in the area.  Two rabbit ears up!!

data.title: Fairly pricey for what you get.
data.text: Our daughters live here and like this restaurant. I personally thought it was a bit expensive for a pizza place. This is your typical California pseudo healthy food type place although the service and ambiance was fine. I tried pork belly appetizer for the first time and that was the best part of the meal. The thin dry crusted pizza did not have much topping on it so I was somewhat disappointed. Think Papa Murphy does a better job with pizza.

data.title: Everything was perfect
data.text:
We stopped in mid-afternoon on a Monday... the place was almost empty, and all the chairs perfectly arranged as if just waiting for customers... so i was a little anxious as to whether this was a popular spot. Well! It must have just been the time of day--Rosso's was wonderful!
Since we only enjoyed a light lunch, i can't give a thorough review; but everything we encountered was great. The host, Michael, was friendly and engaging, and answered all our touristy questions about Petaluma and the area knowledgeably and amiably. Our waitress was fast, professional, and like Michael, very down-to-earth and personable.
I ordered the Capri or Caprese salad. It was beautiful and delicious! There were big pieces of the restaurant's own homemade mozzarella in it... they were like white chicken chunks coated in tasty dressing-- meaty, chewy, and flavorful, yet of course not meat (necessary for a vegetarian like me)! The fresh tomatoes and cucumber curls were mouth-watering.
On the side, i had a piece of the pizzetta flatbread. It was like the Lacey's cookie of the savory world: delicately thin, crispy, combo of flour crust and (in places where the dough was so wispy as to disappear) toasted cheese. With the perfect flavorful herb dusting over all.
My partner got himself a mushroomy, meaty pizza (can't remember its name) which he declared excellent.
The waitress suggested an $8 Sangiovese red to go with my meal... while it was stated that the wine choices change often to go with the seasons, and this one might not be the one they offer next month, i just wanted to note that it was an excellent recommendation. It was sweet and juicy-fruity without being cloying or thick... just the right blend of sweet and dry/spicy.
And the water was clean, without a taste of chlorine!
Although the place was spendy enough that i probably would not make an everyday habit of going there if i lived nearby, i'd be sorely tempted. It was the best!

data.title: Best meal of our trip!
data.text: Good service and amazing food! Our group tried the flatbread pizzas, and the chef's choice which was a gluten free meal and everything was more than we expected! We would definitely recommend this restaurant!

data.title: Margarita Pizza!
data.text: My girlfriend and I went out to grab a bite to eat and chose this restaurant.  It does not have a huge menu but there's something for everyone.  Salads and pizza's mainly.  The fresh mozzarella is out of this world.  I also tried their Bradford Mt. Zin and that was heavenly.  It's laid back and usually busy but the service was good and it's a great little stop if you're in a casual mood.  Parking can be a bit of a pain but there is a free parking garage just around the corner.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised
data.text: Good wine but husband received 2 flat beers. 3rd beer much better after they fixed the co2. Staff bent over backwards to accommodate.  Pizza was soooo good.

data.title: The one and only place that I can eat pizza
data.text: I have tried gluten free pizza at just about all the good pizzerias in Petaluma. One bite tells me all there is to know about how good they are. Terrible really. This is the only place that serves tasty gluten free pizza. However be sure to eat right away as the crust being so thin  will end up becoming brittle when cold. I love their tangy arugula salad.

data.title: Monday Night Dinner
data.text: Well, we've been here at least 5 times, with good luck.  Monday night was not one of those times.  We asked for a table outside next to a heater as we had our grandson with us and it was a bit chilly out.  Well the waiter sat us and came back to say the heater was out of propane.  He moved us to another table with an overhead heater but came back to say it was not working.  He moved us inside and our grandson was starving.  We asked if he could bring us some bread for him.  they were going to bake something for him but that took about 15 minutes, way too long when you have a starving 3 year old.  My wife had Happy Hour clams and a sausage pizza which were good. I had a Cesar Salad and Pizetta which were good.  Our grandson had pasta with butter which was ok.

data.title: Consistently Good!
data.text: Our family goes to Rosso's at least once a month and is very consistent and the staff is awesome! My 4 year old loves to make his own Pizza with a small dough ball they give him... As long as he doesn't eat the dough they cook it up and he eats it with his favorite dipping sauce!

data.title: Average for a napolitano pizza
data.text: I originally tried Rosso's pizza at a winery club members event and I had promised myself to try their pizza on a later occasion.  You can try their pizza is your a in Santa Rosa as well, they have a location there.  The pizzeria is located in the busy part of the town and has an updated modern vibe with an open bar.  It was nice to see that they had a cooking class on a Saturday.  We ordered their arugula salad, margarita pizza and calamari.  The salad had a very nice lemony dressing but it was basically a full plate of arugula and less than 7 fungi- no element of surprise there.  The pizza was nice and balanced but I truly had a better experience with their pizza at the winery that they catered in.  The dough was ok and cheese was not of high quality.  If you are in the neighborhood and looking for a nice pizza this is a place to go but don't make a commute out of this occasion!  Calamari crust was too hard and calamari itself was a bit chewy.

data.title: Get the Burrata!
data.text: This is one of my favorite dinner spots, you can't go wrong eating at Rossos.  I've had people thank me for recommending it to them!  Their homemade burrata trio is amazing!  The salads are all fresh.  They have spoiled me for pizza because they now make my favorite pizza.   I love the variety of choices and creativity of their menu.  Everything is fresh and well-sourced.  You wouldn't expect it but they make the best fried chicken in town, it's amazing!

data.title: Great Fresh and Gluten Free Options
data.text: We really enjoyed an afternoon spent on the patio here with a bottle of wine, cheese plate, and gluten free wood fired flat bread.  The cheeses were very unique (in a good way!).  Our service was friendly and excellent.

data.title: Fresh ingredients in good casual Italian
data.text: Wow, Petaluma is opening good restaurants.  I had lunch here for business.  I love wood fire pizzas.  I had the wedge salad in a piadine.  The lardons really made the wedge. The others in my party had the margherita pizza which looked great.  Another had the carbonara that looked great.  It had a farm poached duck egg.  The color of the carbonara reminded me of southern Italy.  I'm definitely going back.  It's right in the theatre district, by the river in a cute shopping area.

data.title: This would be a five rating if the service had been faster
data.text: I visited here with work colleagues in late September. I love cheese so was quite excited. The menu was nice and I struggled to pick - a colleague and I actually agreed to share our meals so we could try more. I had the trio of cheese starters (yum) and the Fall Fig (thyme, garlic, house made mozzarella, prosciutto, fig and goat's cheese) pizza, which was such a great combo, although they were a touch mean with the topping to dough ratio. The place was reasonably busy (certainly not full), but this was by the far the slowest service I'd had in a very long while. About 45 minutes for our main course. My US colleagues were all for leaving, but my English politeness wasn't up for the fuss. Glad I stayed for the food, but terribly, terribly slow. We even asked for the bill as we were served the main course in case we were forgotten again. Much as I loved the food, I wouldn't go back.

data.title: The real thing!
data.text: Wonderful wood fired pizza, excellent wines, and dazzling salumi. A simple place for family with remarkably good food. (The latter also applies to Petaluma itself!)

data.title: I won't go back
data.text:
The ambiance:  Noisy.  Both TV and loud music.  Don't go if you plan to have a conversation.
The service:  We arrived at 5PM and only a few tables were taken.  It still took over an hour to get our entrees.  After more than half an hour the server appeared to say they were out of the special risotto with short ribs, and we could have polenta or pasta instead.  Why would they be out of a special before 6 in the evening, and why would it take so long to realize they were out of it? 
 I asked if they had herb tea, and the server said they did. I expected to get a selection of teas, as often happens.  Instead she just brought the tea. When I asked what kind it was, she replied, "Herb tea."  
The food:  The butter lettuce with apple and blue cheese was gritty/sandy.  Even inexpensive chain restaurants manage to wash the lettuce.  Is that too much to ask for a $12 salad?   The pizza and the polenta were both mediocre.  
Summary:  over-priced, very slow service, noisy

data.title: In a "foodie" city, this was not spectacular
data.text: The waiter was wonderful.  The place was packed and he was still very friendly.  The food was meh.  Ooh, except for the meatball.  That was incredible.

data.title: Good pizza but..
data.text: We popped in to make a reservation on a saturday night, before going to the movies and were told we didn't need to make one. On our return there was a substantial queue and an apparent 30min wait for a table. The waiting list was messy with people behind us in the queue helping themselves to open seats and other tables remaining unoccupied the whole time we waited. Once we were seated the service was fast (too fast) and we felt rushed to eat and leave. The salad was ordinary to say the least with more leaves than other ingredients. The pizza was small and tasty but overall it was not a pleasant experience.

data.title: walked out
data.text:
Horrible service 
Waited for 35 minutes when multiple open tables were available because the host told us " we were just going to need to hold on" ( with attitude) 
Disappointed as the food looked good. Plenty of other good options with good service in Petaluma.
